ownerId.description: Assigned by the application and returned in responses, ownerId is a unique identifier of the owner.

organizationName.description: The organization/business name of the owner.

type.description: The type of owner group. JOINT - joint tenancy; SOLE - sole ownership; COMMON - tenants in common; JT - joint tenancy (deprecated); SO - sole ownership (deprecated); TC - tenants in common (deprecated).

partyType.description: The type of owner. Always included in responses. Only required in requests when specifying an executor, trustee, trust, or administrator. OWNER_IND - individual owner; OWNER_BUS - organization or business owner; EXECUTOR - executor of an estate; TRUSTEE - trustee of an estate; TRUST - trust beneficiary company; ADMINISTRATOR - administrator of an estate.

description.description: Required and only used when the partyType value is EXECUTOR, TRUSTEE, or ADMINISTRATOR. Describes the party.

phoneNumber.description: The owner phone number formatted as only digits: no spaces, periods, or dashes.

suffix.description: The organization or individual name suffix.

deathCertificateNumber.description: Include only for a transfer due to death registration types when the owner in the deleteOwnerGroups is deceased.

deathDateTime.description: Include only for transfer due to death registration types when the owner in the deleteOwnerGroups is deceased. Must be in the past when the registration is submitted.

corpNumber.description: Optional business company number. Include in a request if available and the added owner is a business/organziation.

deathCorpNumber.description: Include only for transfer due to death registration types when the owner is in the deleteOwnerGroups, not added, and is a business/organization.

previousOwnerId.description: Optional for an addOwnerGroups owner, used in transfer registrations to indicate the owner information has been changed except for the name. In other words, the previousOwnerId in an an addOwnerGroups owner maps to an ownerId in a deleteOwnerGroups owner and the names must be identical.
